document_data.name: Bruha Oakhide
document_data.mainbody:
'''Bruha Oakhide''', wife of [[Thatmatt Oakhide]], was a commoner inhabitant of the [[Lower City]] of [[Baldur's Gate]] in the late 15{{th}} century [[DR]].

{{quote|''We're too poor to leave. But too scared to stay - like half the city.''|Bruha Oakhide}}
document_data.Description: Bruha was a brown-eyes and light-skinned [[gold dwarf]] with her face splattered in freckles. She kept her face clean shaven and let her mane of red curly hair loose.
document_data.History: In the {{YearlinkName|1492}}, during the [[Absolute crisis]], Bruha and her husband were faced with the dangers of increased crime and looming war. Thatmatt Oakhide was mugged twice in one month despite him always carrying a weapon and the [[Flaming Fist]] outpost in the [[Basilisk Gate]] did not bother to act on the couple's reports. Like so many commoners of the Gate, Bruha and Thatmatt were unable to leave the city.
